means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 克伦奇 Clinch的变体

sentence.Network_en: Patsy had to clench her jaw to suppress her anger.
sentence.Network_cn: 帕奇只得咬紧牙关压住怒气。

sentence.Network_en: I felt the clench of his hand on my arm.
sentence.Network_cn: 我感觉到他的手牢牢抓住我的胳臂.

sentence.Network_en: Happiness seems meteor, who can accompany to me clench it.
sentence.Network_cn: 幸福就像流星, 谁是那个陪我抓住流星的人.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English (in the sense of clinch 'fix securely'): of Germanic origin; related to cling

entry.def: When you clench your fist or your fist clenches, you curl your fingers up tightly, usually because you are very angry.

example.ex: Alex clenched her fists and gritted her teeth...
example.tran: 亚历克丝攥紧拳头，牙咬得咯咯响。

example.ex: She pulled at his sleeve and he turned on her, fists clenching again before he saw who it was.
example.tran: 她拉了拉他的袖子，他双拳再次握紧，气冲冲地转过身来，这才发现是她。

entry.tran: (通常指生气、不安时)咬紧(牙齿)，咬牙切齿
entry.def: When you clench your teeth or they clench, you squeeze your teeth together firmly, usually because you are angry or upset.

example.ex: Patsy had to clench her jaw to suppress her anger...
example.tran: 帕奇只得咬紧牙关压住怒气。

example.ex: Slowly, he released his breath through clenched teeth.
example.tran: 他从紧咬的牙缝间慢慢地舒了口气。

entry.def: If you clench something in your hand or in your teeth, you hold it tightly with your hand or your teeth.

example.ex: I clenched the arms of my chair.

means.word_mean: 1. a small slip noose made with seizing

sentences.sentence: "he released his clasp on my arm"
"he has a strong grip for an old man"
"she kept a firm hold on the railing"

auth_sentence.content: You can see them when you clench your fists, because your knuckles are the ends of your metacarpals.

means.word_mean: 紧握, 抓紧, 咬紧

sentences.en: She clenched her teeth and refused to move.
sentences.cn: 她咬紧牙关不肯挪动一步。

jushi.english: Their fists were clenched so tightly that their nails dug deep into their palms.
jushi.chinese: 他们紧握着拳头，指甲深深地捏进了手心。

jushi.english: He clenched his fist and his face was very red.
jushi.chinese: 他握紧拳头,脸涨得通红。
